content: It happened one Sabbath, when He went for a meal at the house of one of the ruling Pharisees, that they were watching Him closely  carefully [hoping to entrap Him].
And there in front of Him was a man who had dropsy (extreme swelling).
And Jesus asked the lawyers and the Pharisees,
But they kept silent. Then He took hold of the man and healed him, and sent him on his way.
And they were unable to reply to this.
Now Jesus  telling a parable to the invited guests when He noticed how they had been selecting the places of honor , saying to them,  [to eat]    [to eat]   [before others],
Jesus also went on to say to the one who had invited Him,
When one of those who were reclining  with Him heard this, he said to Him, “Blessed (happy, prosperous, to be admired) is he who will eat bread in the kingdom of God!”
But Jesus said to him,      [recently]   [his master,]  [at the rejections of his invitation]   [after returning]   [with guests].  [and declined]

Now large crowds were going along with Jesus; and He turned and said to them,  [in the sense of indifference to or relative disregard for them in comparison with his attitude toward God]—  [expressing a willingness to endure whatever may come]  [believing in Me, conforming to My example in living and, if need be, suffering or perhaps dying because of faith in Me]   [for his guards],   [the building],     [if he feels he is not powerful enough],  [king]   [carefully consider the cost and then for My sake]
